label: Description

Figure of Cupids Representing Air, from a Group Called "The Elements"

label: Description
value: Two cherubs under a tree on a mound of ricks with clinging vegetation. Standing cherub at left sharpening an Arrowpoint on a grindstone. Seated cherub holds a torch in an upraised hand.

Figure of Cupids Fishing Representing Water, from a Group Called "The Elements"

label: Description
value: Two cherubs under a tree on a mound of rocks with a waterfall and sea life. The seated cherub transfers fish from a small bucket to a net held by the standing figure.

label: Description
value: Clasp bracelet in Gothic style, made of nine links of heart-shaped ornaments placed base to base with open flower larger units in a similar design with a pale blue stone.  Accompanying box  covered in dark red paper, tooled in gilt, and lined with velvet and satin.

label: Physical description
value: Aquamarine, gilt metal (bracelet); paper, gilt, velvet, satin (box)

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Ornamental tortoiseshell comb with large decorative panel carved as scrolling leaves above long teeth.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. John Innes Kane; 1926: bequested to Museum

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Shaped open back with voluted top rail and two horizontal crossing members enclosing a verre églomisé panel bearing the arms of the Earl of Scarsdale (extinct 1735).  Cabriole sharply raking rear legs, voluted at knees, and with moulded ankles and Dutch feet.  Voluted cabriole front legs with gilded pewter mounts at knees; hoof feet.  Gilded  pewter mask in center of front seat rail.  Slip seat.

label: Physical description
value: Walnut and beechwood, gilt pewter, gilt and reverse-painted glass (verre églomisé) panel, mortise-and-tenon construction

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. John Innes Kane; 1926: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Three, curvilinear-shaped splats characterize back.  Upper posts are tapered.  Two lateral and two longitudinal stretchers.  Upholstered seat (light pink).

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: The chair's caned seat is rounded at its corners.  Its openwork back has drapery swags joined by small diamond-shaped medallions painted in black and white with cherub figures.  The legs taper and are painted with vertical lines and foliage; the back supports are similarly decorated and have ivory finials.

label: Physical description
value: Satinwood with painted decoration, ivory, caned seat

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Slip seat. Plain cabroile legs ending in club feet; rounded back, vase-shaped splat.  Seat-rail, shaped, and back are veneered.  Legs joined by stretchers, the front one of turned baluster form.

label: Physical description
value: Walnut with walnut veneer on poplar seat rail

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Upholstered rounded channeled back crested with carved spray of two flowers - curved padded arms - shaped rails frame upholstered seat, channeling conturned into the cabriole front legs - front rail carved similarly as cresting cabriole rear legs.

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Upright, rectangular form; veneered surface with two drawers surmounted by a drop front panel with inlay of light wood bands around edges, stars at corners and gilt bronze escutcheon in form of trophy; drawers with gilt bronze circular pulls and lily-of-the-valley escutcheons; rectangular gilt bronze handles on left and right side; two paw feet with gilt foliate decoration in front; turned rear feet.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. John Innes Kane; 1926: acquired by Museum

value: Waistcoat fragment of taupe silk embroidered with a multicolored design of flowers (snowdrops, violas), strawberries and butterflies.

label: Description
value: Garment has a full skirt and sleeveless bodice with eyelets for lacing down the back. Blue fabric is a ribbed silk heavily brocaded with silver, gold and multicolored threads in a floral design. Bodice is lined with rose-colored taffeta.

value: Medium: silk, metallic yarns Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade); plain woven lining

label: Description
value:
Narrow panel of blue and white linen. Design in horizontal rows, two motifs repeating alternately: a walled city with the inscription "Gerusalem," and the Resurrection with the inscription, "ich bin die auferstehung und das Leben Johan am 11" (I am the Resurrection and the Life, John chapter 11)

"R" embroidered in red linen cross-stitch in the lower right corner. Triangular pocket of same material on back at lower edge.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: damask, cross stitch

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 43.2 x 36 cm (17 x 14 3/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Man's waistcoat of white satin embroidered with multicolored silk thread. Allover design of spiral vines and tiny blossoms. Border design of maroon and green. Pattern of flower sprays down the center front. Basket of flowers under each pocket.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: embroidered on satin weave

label: Description
value: Urn shaped body on stem with stepped, circular foot; urn shaped finial on domed cover extending over lip; body decorated with beading and bright-cut engraving; family arms engraved on both sides; tan wood handle with leaf attachments.

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Three branched candelabrum in form of an oak tree. Base outlined by three reverse curves; column represents a tree trunk (from which the lower branches have been cut) with leaves at the top and four twisting branches; three of the branches have acorns serving as sockets for candles. The section above the leaves is removable.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. John Innes Kane; 1926: bequested to Museum

value: Bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane
